section.name: What is Toolforge ?
section.p: Toolforge is the Sourceforge project name for a suite of tools related to build, release and configuration management. The product is known as Karma which is derived from Code And Release Management Application, but 'CARMA' wasn't good enough a name for us.

section.name: What is Karma ?
section.p:
Karma is a tool that is positioned in the following areas of software development:
Component Management
Version Management
Build Management
Release Management

The tool (and more than that, its methodology) supports software developers and release managers in their quest to manage software systems, components and modules. A true enabler of a smooth software logistics process (yep ...).

Component based development requires more than a version control system to manage source code and build tools to build that source code. It requires that software components can be easily managed, exchanged, reused.

Our early releases of Karma showed that developers, familiar with tools like Ant and Maven needed to be convinced of the power of the Karma concept: "We have Maven to do that.", "Why don't we build an extension to Ant for this ?". So far, we've been able to convince everyone that Karma offers more.
Anyway, so far for the sales talk. All of it is true, but let's continue and make it happen.

section.name: What is there to use ?
section.p: The Toolforge project on Sourceforge contains what is there to get. Read the basics section before anything else to get an idea of what Karma could mean for your organization.
Released versions of Karma can be found at Sourceforge.
